description:
When using Nova vmware driver to attach a raw iscsi volume (using 'RDMp' style) to a VM, found the iscsi volume is attached to the VM's VirtualIDEController. It's expected to attached to a scsi controller, such as VirtualLsiLogicSASController.  

In nova.virt.vmwareapi.volumeops.py, the method of ' _attach_volume_iscsi' gets the adapter type:

(vmdk_file_path, adapter_type, disk_type) = vm_util.get_vmdk_path_and_adapter_type(hardware_devices)

The method get_vmdk_path_and_adapter_type will iterate all the hardware devices, and return the adapter type of the first Virtual Disk it reads. If the first virtual disk is not an iscsi disk, e.g., an IDE disk, then VirtualIDEController will be returned as the adapter type, and the iscsi volume will be attached to that incorrect controller.

To fix this issue, we perhaps need a new method to find a suitable existing scsi controller for the volume, or to create a new controller if there's no scsi controller right now.
title: VMWare: attach a iscsi volume to a VirtualIDEController

comments.content: Read the code again and I think it's not necessary to create a new controller if there's no scsi controller. It would be good enough to return a correct adapter type (such as lsiLogicsas) because the driver will allocate or create the controller automatically. See the vm_util.allocate_controller_key_and_unit_number.

commit c00a2ea6f8965ddbb9ea55e31cbc863e894ffffe
Author: Jin Hui <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Dec 31 16:08:14 2014 +0800

    Vmware:Find a SCSI adapter type for attaching iSCSI disk
    
    It needs to find out a proper SCSI adapter before attaching an
    iSCSI disk. Current logic is to get an existing disk and use its
    adapter type to create and attach iSCSI disk. So an SCSI disk
    would be created under an IDE controller if the existing
    disk is an IDE disk. This fix will find out a SCSI controller from
    the vm and return its corresponding adapter type.
    
    Change-Id: I33b6f3a88a5253755971622b4f05a30f48003331
    Closes-bug: #1386511
